edu.stanford.nlp.naturalli

Class Polarity

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.stanford.nlp.naturalli.Polarity

  • public class Polarity
extends Object

    A class intended to be attached to a lexical item, determining what mutations are valid on it while maintaining valid Natural Logic inference.

    Author:
    Gabor Angeli

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Polarity DEFAULT
      The default (very permissive) polarity.

    • Constructor Summary

        Polarity(byte[] projectionFunction)

      Create a polarity from a list of operators in scope

      • Polarity

        public Polarity(byte[] projectionFunction)

    • Method Detail

      • projectLexicalRelation

        public NaturalLogicRelation projectLexicalRelation(NaturalLogicRelation lexicalRelation)
        Project the given natural logic lexical relation on this word. So, for example, if we want to go up the Hypernymy hierarchy (NaturalLogicRelation.FORWARD_ENTAILMENT) on this word, then this function will tell you what relation holds between the new mutated fact and this fact.
        Parameters:
        lexicalRelation - The lexical relation we are applying to this word.
        Returns:
        The relation between the mutated sentence and the original sentence.

      • maintainsTruth

        public boolean maintainsTruth(NaturalLogicRelation lexicalRelation)
        If true, applying this lexical relation to this word creates a sentence which is entailed by the original sentence, Note that both this, and negatesTruth(NaturalLogicRelation) can be false. If this is the case, then natural logic can neither verify nor disprove this mutation.

      • negatesTruth

        public boolean negatesTruth(NaturalLogicRelation lexicalRelation)
        If true, applying this lexical relation to this word creates a sentence which is negated by the original sentence Note that both this, and maintainsTruth(NaturalLogicRelation)} can be false. If this is the case, then natural logic can neither verify nor disprove this mutation.

      • maintainsFalsehood

        public boolean maintainsFalsehood(NaturalLogicRelation lexicalRelation)
        See Also:
        maintainsTruth(NaturalLogicRelation)

      • negatesFalsehood

        public boolean negatesFalsehood(NaturalLogicRelation lexicalRelation)
        See Also:
        negatesTruth(NaturalLogicRelation)

      • isUpwards

        public boolean isUpwards()
        Ignoring exclusion, determine if this word has upward polarity.
